section.title: What is ircg?
section.para: With ircg you can build powerful, fast and scalable webchat solutions in conjunction with dedicated or public IRC servers.

section.title: Platforms
section.para:
IRCG runs under
AIX
FreeBSD
HP-UX
Irix
Linux
Solaris
Tru64

section.title: Requirements
section.para:
To install and use IRCG you need the following software:
IRCG-Library from Sascha Schumann.
SGI Static Threads Library
thttpd webserver

section.title: Installation
section.para: A detailed installation instruction can be found here.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Connect to an IRC server

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: ircg_pconnect will try to establish a connection to an IRC server and return a connection resource handle for further use.

The only mandatory parameter is username, this will set your initial nickname on the server. server_ip and server_port are optional and default to 127.0.0.1 and 6667.
For now parameter server_ip will not do any hostname lookups and will only accept IP addresses in numerical form.
Currently ircg_pconnect always returns a valid handle, even if the connection failed.
You can customize the output of IRC messages and events by selection a format string set previously created with ircg_register_format_messages by specifing the sets name in msg_format.
See also: ircg_disconnect, ircg_is_conn_alive, ircg_register_format_messages.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Returns the error from previous ircg operation

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: ircg_fetch_error_msg returns the error from the last called ircg function.

note.para: Errorcode is stored in first array element, errortext in second.

example.title: ircg_fetch_error_msg example

refnamediv.refpurpose: Set current connection for output

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Select the current connection for output in this execution context. Every output sent from the server connected to by connection will be copied to standard output while using default formatting or a format string set specified by ircg_register_format_messages and selected by ircg_lookup_format_messages.
See also: ircg_register_format_messages and ircg_lookup_format_messages.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Join a channel on a connected server

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Join the channel channel on the server connected to by connection.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Leave a channel on server

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Leave the channel channel on the server connected to by connection.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Send message to channel or user on server

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: ircg_msg will send the message to a channel or user on the server connected to by connection. A recipient starting with # or & will send the message to a channel, anything else will be interpreted as a username.
Setting the optional parameter suppress to a &true; value will suppress output of your message to your own connection.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Send a notice to a user on server

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: This function will send the message text to the user nick on the server connected to by connection. Query your IRC documentation of choice for the exact difference between a MSG and a NOTICE.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Change nickname on server

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Change your nickname on the given connection to the one given in nick if possible.
Will return &true; on success and &false; on failure.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Set topic for channel on server

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Change the topic for channel channel on the server connected to by connection to new_topic.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Set channel mode flags for user

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Set channel mode flags for channel on server connected to by connection. Mode flags are passed in mode_spec and are applied to the user specified by nick.

Mode flags are set or cleared by specifind a mode character and prepending it with a plus or minus character respectively. E.g. operator mode is granted by '+o' and revoked by '-o' passed as mode_spec.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Encodes HTML preserving output

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Encodes a HTML string html_string for output. This feature could be usable, e.g. if someone wants to discuss about an html problem.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Query user information for nick on server

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Sends a query to the connected server connection to send information for the specified user nick.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Kick a user out of a channel on server

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Kick user nick from channel on server connected to by connection. reason should give a short message describing why this action was performed.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Add a user to your ignore list on a server

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: This function will add user nick to your ignore list on the server connected to by connection. By doing so you will suppress all messages from this user from being send to you.
See also: ircg_ignore_del.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Remove a user from your ignore list on a server

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: This function remove user nick from your ignore list on the server connected to by connection.
See also: ircg_ignore_add.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Close connection to server

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: ircg_disconnect will close a connection to a server previously established with ircg-pconnect.
See also: ircg_pconnect.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Check connection status

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: ircg_is_conn_alive returns &true; if connection is still alive and working or &false; if the server no longer talks to us.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Select a set of format strings for display of IRC messages

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Select the set of format strings to use for display of IRC messages and events. Sets may be registered with ircg_register_format_messages, a default set named ircg is always available.
See also: ircg_register_format_messages

refnamediv.refpurpose: Register a set of format strings for display of IRC messages

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: With ircg_register_format_messages you can customize the way your IRC output looks like. You can even register different format string sets and switch between them on the fly with ircg_lookup_format_messages.

listitem.simpara: Some user was kicked from the channel

refsect1.para: See also: ircg_lookup_format_messages.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Set hostaction to be execute when connection dies

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: In case of the termination of connection connection IRCG will connect to host at port (Note: host must be an IPv4 address, IRCG does not resolve host-names due to blocking issues), send data to the new host connection and will wait until the remote part closes connection. This can be used to trigger a php script for example.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Set logfile for connection

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Function ircg_set_file specifies a logfile path in which all output from connection connection will be logged. Returns &true; on success, otherwise &false;.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Get username for connection

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Function ircg_get_username returns the username for specified connection connection. Returns &false; if connection died or is not valid.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Encode special characters in nickname to be IRC-compliant

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Function ircg_nickname_escape returns a decoded nickname specified by nick wich is IRC-compliant.
See also: ircg_nickname_unescape

refnamediv.refpurpose: Decodes encoded nickname

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: Function ircg_nickname_unescape returns a decoded nickname, which is specified in nick.
See also: ircg_nickname_escape
